intro: Impatiens filicaulis, commonly known as the broadleaf impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, glossy leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows as an annual or herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. It prefers moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for shaded garden beds. Its rapid growth and vibrant blooms make it a valuable addition to ornamental horticulture.
